children.name: Adapter
children.definition: A device designed to make different pieces of apparatus compatible

children.name: Amplifier
children.definition: An electronic device designed to take an input signal and output an increased signal strength

children.name: Analyzer
children.definition: A device used to analyse data, signals, equipment performance, etc., or to measure and collect data for analysis

children.name: Aspirator
children.definition: A device that aspirates, breathes, or blows upon; A device that draws a stream of air or gas through a tube

children.name: Balancer
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Bander
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Blancher
children.definition: A device used to turn something white (chiefly by loss of colour)

children.name: Blender
children.definition: A device that mixes, mingles, unites intimately, so as to form a uniform or harmonious mixture

children.name: Blower
children.definition: A device that produces a current of air; a device that sets something in motion with a current of air

children.name: Boiler
children.definition: A device that, through the action of heat, causes a liquid to bubble up and pass into the gaseous form

children.name: Bonder
children.definition: A device that holds objects together so as to give solidity

children.name: Buffer
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Burner
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Calibrater
children.definition: A device that determines the correct position, value, capacity, etc., of an instrument so that readings taken from it are absolute rather than relative

children.name: Chiller
children.definition: A device that recirculates chilled fluids that is used for applications requiring heat removal across a wide temperature range

children.name: Circulator
children.definition: A device that moves materials round a circuit or circuitous course through a system of pipes, or the like

children.name: Cleaner
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Clipper
children.definition: A device that cuts with scissors or shears, often with the notion of making trim and tidy

children.name: Coater
children.definition: A device that covers an object with a surface layer or coating (or with successive layers) of any substance

children.name: Collector
children.definition: A device that gathers or makes a collection of given materials

children.name: Concentrator
children.definition: A device designed to increase the weight per unit volume of a substance

children.name: Condenser
children.definition: A device that reduces vapour to the liquid condition (esp. by cooling)

children.name: Controller
children.definition: A mechanism or apparatus for controlling a device or some aspect of its operation; a component which regulates or restricts the operation of another part of a device

children.name: Conveyor
children.definition: A device that carries or transmits

children.name: Cooker
children.definition: A device that prepares or makes ready food; to make fit for eating by due application of heat, as by boiling, baking, roasting, broiling, etc

children.name: Cooler
children.definition: A device that makes a substance become less hot or warm

children.name: Counter
children.definition: A device designed to keep track of the number of times something happens

children.name: Crimper
children.definition: A device that compresses something into small regular folds or ridges, corrugates, or frills

children.name: Crusher
children.definition: A device that compresses with violence, so as to break, bruise, destroy, or squeeze out of natural shape or condition

children.name: Culturer
children.definition: A device that propagates, grows, or develops (microorganisms, cells, tissues, etc.) under artificial conditions on or in a nutrient medium

children.name: Cutter
children.definition: A device that penetrates with an edged instrument which severs the continuity of the substance

children.name: Cycler
children.definition: A device that moves or revolves materials in a period in which a certain round of events or phenomena is completed, recurring in the same order in succeeding periods of the same length

children.name: Decapper
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Deduster
children.definition: A device used to separate dust or other fine particles from another material

children.name: Defibrillator
children.definition: A device that delivers a therapeutic dose of electrical energy to the heart. This depolarizes a critical mass of the heart muscle, terminates the arrhythmia, and allows normal sinus rhythm to be reestablished by the body's natural pacemaker, in the sinoatrial node of the heart. Defibrillators can be external, transvenous, or implanted, depending on the type of device used or needed

children.name: Degasser
children.definition: A device that removes unwanted gas from a given substance

children.name: Desiccator
children.definition: A device that desiccates or dries; a name given to an apparatus used to dry substances through heat or by exposure to the air

children.name: Detector
children.definition: A mechanical, electrical, or chemical device with sensor properties, that automatically identifies and records or registers a stimulus, such as change in pressure or temperature or content, movement, an electrical signal, radiation from a radioactive material or presence of subatomic particles, etc

children.name: Dicer
children.definition: A device that cuts into dice or cubes

children.name: Dispenser
children.definition: A device designed to give out the contents in convenient or/and prescribed amounts

children.name: Disperser
children.definition: A device that causes materials to separate in different directions; to throw or drive about in all directions, to scatter; to rout

children.name: Digester
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Dissector
children.definition: A device that cuts up (an animal body, a plant, etc.) for the purpose of displaying the position, structure, and relations of the various internal parts; to anatomize

children.name: Distiller
children.definition: A device that subjects materials to the process of distillation; to vaporize a substance by means of heat, and then condense the vapour by exposing it to cold, so as to obtain the substance or one of its constituents in a state of concentration or purity. Primarily said of a liquid, the vapour of which when condensed is again deposited in minute drops of pure liquid; but extended also to the volatilizing of solids, the products of which may be gaseous.

children.name: Dryer
children.definition: A device that removes moisture

children.name: Emulsifier
children.definition: A chemical substance/A device that that functions to stabilize an emulsion

children.name: Etcher
children.definition: A device that engraves (metals, sometimes glass, stone) by ‘eating away’ the surface with acids or other corrosives; chiefly, to engrave by this process (a copper or other metal plate) for the purpose of printing from it. Hence, to produce (figures), copy or reproduce (pictures, drawings, etc.), represent or portray (subjects) by this method

children.name: Evaporator
children.definition: A device designed either to drive a volatile solvent from a material or to cause vaporization within a heating/cooling system

children.name: Extractor
children.definition: A device designed to remove or separate a material or object from some other material or object

children.name: Extruder
children.definition: A device that urges, forces, or expels a substance from something

children.name: Fermentor
children.definition: A bioreactor that provides a sterilie environment, ideal for growth of any bacteria, yeast, or fungi

children.name: Filler
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Fluidizer
children.definition: A device that causes (a mass of finely divided solid) to assume fluidity and other characteristics of a liquid by passing a current of gas, vapour, or liquid upwards through it

children.name: Fractionator
children.definition: A device that separates (a mixture) by distillation or otherwise into portions of differing properties

children.name: Freezer
children.definition: A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C)

children.name: Fryer
children.definition: A device that cooks (food) with fat in a shallow pan over the fire

children.name: Generator
children.definition: An engine designed to produce electricity or a device designed to produce a vapor or gas

children.name: Grabber
children.definition: A device that grasps or seizes

children.name: Granulator
children.definition: A device that transforms a substance into small grains, small compact particles, or pellets

children.name: Grinder
children.definition: A device that reduces a substance to small particles or powder by crushing between two hard surfaces

children.name: Handler
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Heater
children.definition: A device that communicates heat to, makes hot, warms, or raises the temperature of a substance

children.name: Homogenizer
children.definition: A device that renders materials homogeneous, unites or incorporates into a single whole of uniform composition; makes uniform or similar

children.name: Husker
children.definition: A device that removes the the dry outer integument of certain fruits and seeds; esp. the hard fibrous sheath of grain, nuts, etc.; a glume or rind

children.name: Hybridizer
children.definition: A device that subjects species or varieties of plants or animals to cross-breed and produce hybrid entities

children.name: Ice Maker
children.definition: A device that produces water frozen in the solid state

children.name: Identifier
children.definition: A device that ascertains or asserts what a thing or who a person is; to determine the identity of; to recognize as belonging to a particular category or kind; to refer (a plant, animal, or mineral specimen) to its correct species

children.name: Illuminator
children.definition: A device that illuminates or gives light

children.name: Imager
children.definition: A device designed to create or record a visual representation of something

children.name: Incubator
children.definition: A device in which environmental conditions (light, photoperiod, temperature, humidity, etc.) can be controlled

children.name: Inhibitor
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Lighter
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Integrator
children.definition: A device that indicates or registers the total amount or mean value of some physical quantity, as area, temperature, etc

children.name: Liner
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Liquefier
children.definition: A device that reduces a substance into a liquid condition

children.name: Logger
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Lyophilizer
children.definition: A device that is used to freeze dry material

children.name: Manipulator
children.definition: A mechanical device for handling radioactive or hazardous material, operated by remote control from behind a protective shield

children.name: Mixer
children.definition: A mechanical device designed to blend materials or an electronic device designed to blend signals

children.name: Monitor
children.definition: A device than includes a sensor designed to give information about the presence of a substance or the state of a system

children.name: Magnifier
children.definition: An optical device that enlarges the apparent size of an image or object

children.name: Marker
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Nebulizer
children.definition: A device that administers medicinal substance(s) in the form of a liquid mist to the patient airways. Nebulizer pumps air or oxygen through a liquid medicine to turn it into a vapor, which is then inhaled by the patient

children.name: Peeler
children.definition: A device that removes the natural outer layer of something

children.name: Pipettor
children.definition: A device that allows remote operation of a pipette, usually by the attachment of an extension tube. Also: a machine that automates multiple pipetting

children.name: Plotter
children.definition: A computer driven device designed for drawing graphs and pictures

children.name: Polisher
children.definition: An mechanical device that enables precise sample thinning and polishing of a wide range of materials

children.name: Presser
children.definition: A device that applies pressure

children.name: Primer
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Reactor
children.definition: A device in which a chemical reaction takes place or an electronic device designed to add reactance to a circuit

children.name: Refrigerator
children.definition: A device which consists of a thermally insulated compartment and a mechanical, chemical, or electronic heat pump that transfers heat from the inside of the fridge to its external environment such that the inside of the fridge is cooled to a temperature below the ambient temperature of the room

children.name: Regulator
children.definition: A device that controls the rate or manner in which a process progresses or a product is formed

children.name: Scanner
children.definition: An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range

children.name: Sequencer
children.definition: A device that arranges materials in a definite order

children.name: Shaker
children.definition: A device that moves irregularly and quickly to and fro, up and down, or from side to side

children.name: Shredder
children.definition: A device that cuts or tears into shreds or narrow strips;

children.name: Sorter
children.definition: A device that allots, apportions, or assigns order

children.name: Stabilizer
children.definition: A device designed to reduce unwanted movement

children.name: Stainer
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Stirrer
children.definition: A device that agitates so as to alter the relative position of the parts of a liquid, or a soft or semi-liquid mass; esp. to agitate with a more or less circular continuous movement, as with a spoon, so as to mix the particles or promote solution of solid matter

children.name: Tester
children.definition: A device that subjects materials to a test of any kind; to try, put to the proof; to ascertain the existence, genuineness, or quality of

children.name: Tracer
children.definition: Definition coming soon

children.name: Warmer
children.definition: A device that makes a material object moderately hot

children.name: Washer
children.definition: A device designed to cleanse an object
